line.en: 'Good morning...'
'Wow Hotaru, you're looking cute as ever!'
'Hee hee'
'So squishy'
'I always think, you are way too cute to be\nAgeha's sister'
Hotaru is extremely popular with the others in\nthe dorm.
She comes every morning so she's become a\nfamiliar face... well even more than a familiar\nface if she gets this kind of treatment.
'Hotaru, why don't you come to our school?'
'Yeah, you could stay with Ageha, The girls would\ntake good care of you'
'Quit creeping me out Aoi'
'Hey, hey. Everyone understands your feelings, so\nit's OK.'
'Understands what?'
'Hotaru, you're too cute, so it would be\nimpossible.'
'Cute...'
'Ah! Aoi is flirting with Hotaru!'
'Hey, that's not fair.'
'I'm not flirting!'
'You're not?'
'I'm not.'
'Hmmm...'
She pouts, looking dissatisfied.
Prettily, she continues pouting.
'Whaa!'
'Ah sorry, they just looked so soft I couldn't\nhelp myself'
'Hey! That's not fair!'
'I want to try too!'
From all directions fingers stretch out and start\npoking and prodding at Hotaru's cheeks.
'Eek! Yah! Aoi, help!'
'Hey, guys! Hurry up and eat your breakfast!\nWe'll be late!'
'Morning.'
'Hey.'
'Good morning!'
'Ah, morning.'
Kotori's eyes begin looking over Hotaru's\nshoulders.
'If you're looking for Ageha, she's already\nleft.'
'Again? Seriously, what is she up to?'
'You haven't heard?'
Hotaru shakes her head.
Oh, so Hotaru doesn't know, huh?
Seriously, what is she doing?
She could at least tell me.
Everyone finishes breakfast, cleans their plates,\nand heads to school.
Hotaru walks by my side as I push Kotori's\nwheelchair. The Kazato sisters follow behind.
Until now Ageha would usually join up with us on\nthe way.
It's been a while since that stopped happening.
'Is Ageha not coming today as well?'
'If she doesn't come we can't get down to any\nserious work.'
'I can't believe you would say this in front of\nyour club leader.'
'Hat! Come with me.'
'Quack!'
'Wow!'
'That's amazing Kotori!'
'Hee hee, this is where a club leader shows her\nnatural virtue.'
'Well, Hat is a bird so I guess you'd say natural\nvirtue.'
'This is also your punishment Hat!'
'Quack, quack!'
'Haaaa!'
'Ha... Haha'
A rare site, Hotaru laughs out loud.
Now that I think about it, Hotaru almost never\nlaughs like this.
Even though they're sisters she is the complete\nopposite of Ageha.
Ageha will laugh out loud about almost anything.
Even though their faces look alike, it's hard to\nbelieve their personalities would differ so much.
If I'd had any brothers I wonder if we would have\nbeen similar or completely different.
'Ah I want to fly!'
Kotori suddenly flings both her arms up in the\nair.
'What brought that on?'
'I looked at the hat and was reminded of it.'
'It's already been a year. A year since it\nhappened. Since then I haven't flown even once'
That's true.
In my case, I've flown around the gliding area\nmany times.
But... Kotori, Ageha and everyone else haven't.\nThey haven't been able to experience this.
Not to mention... to fly with our own wings... we\nhaven't done that once since the incident last\nyear.
'If we keep going like this, soon it will be\nSummer. Then it'll come.'
'You mean the 'Morning Glory''
'Yeah! The cloud passage! It will come.'
'You're sure about that?'
'Of course! Right, Aoi?'
'Yeah!'
Despite the suddenness of the question, I respond\nwithout hesitation.
We will fly up into the sky with our own wings.
The dream which, lying dormant inside me this\npast year, has been gradually getting stronger\nand is coming alive.
That dream will become reality this summer, the\nseason just began.
That's the reason we're all working so hard.
That's why I know it will come.
The Morning Glory will come.
What happened last year was a sign.
All the data points to it.
'It will come this year.'
'Right!'
'It will definitely come.'
I clench my fists.
'And then we will all fly.'
'Yes, we will fly.'
'We'll fly together!'
Kotori clenches her fists, Asa excitedly thrusts\nher arms out wide.
We all look up at the blue sky.
There we can see white wings dancing.
The new gliders we have made dancing in the wind.
Our wings.
This sky will become ours.
'Seriously... you guys are a strange bunch.'
Even though she says this, Yoru has a happy glint\nin her eye.
I suddenly feel uneasy.
'Hey Hotaru What about Ageha?'
'Ageha?'
'Did she say anything to you?'
'Mmm, no, nothing.'
'Hey, hey...'
Well, just because she hasn't said anything to\nHotaru doesn't mean Ageha's feelings aren't the\nsame as ours.
'But she is definitely fired up.'
'Fired up?'
'Her eyes are always burning with intensity.\nWhenever she heads out she is full of energy.\nLike a fireball.'
'Heads out... you mean everyday?'
'Yeah.'
'I see...'
For some reason, Ageha's recent behavior doesn't\nquite add up.
Obviously part of that is due to the fact that I\ndon't know what she's doing.
What does Ageha actually think about flying?
I haven't actually directly asked her that\nquestion.
Tobioka isn't anywhere to be seen near the school\ngates.
Hotaru tightly tugs on my sleeve.
'Yeah?'
'Um... well...'
'Ah, right.'

Now that I think about it, she's right, the
members of the Soaring club shouldn't get too
close to each other, since doing so might arouse
Tobioka's suspicion.
If Kotori isn't with me, that would seem strange.
I let Asa and Yoru go first.
Then after a minute passes, we also start to head\ntowards the school gates.
I lightly pull Hotaru towards me.
'Yeah...'
'Help me push, OK?'
We begin to push Kotori's wheelchair together.
'Ah you guys look so sweet together.'
'That's because Ageha authorized this, right?'
'Yeah I know.'
'I wonder what that girl is thinking?'
'Heave ho, heave ho.'
Hotaru cheerfully pushes the wheelchair.
We part with Hotaru and walk towards our\nclassroom.
'Ah, someone's here.'
'Yeah, yeah. Your girlfriend right?'
'What are you talking about? All I can hear is\nchatter.'
'I didn't hear anything.'
'Yo! You're late, Leader!'
'You're just early. What are you doing every\nmorning?'
That's Kotori for you. She reads the situation,\nsends out her feelers, and suddenly attacks.
'You know, various things.'
But Ageha is quite used to Kotori's ways and,\nunfazed, she nimbly avoids the question.
'What do you mean "various things"? Why don't you\njust explain?'
Kotori shoots an even more direct question.
My feelings also ride with her interrogation.
Yeah, Ageha, tell us what you've been doing.
If you don't, we can't calm down, and get to work\nnow, can we?
'Ahh, well, you see. There's still a lot of stuff\nI can't talk about...'
'Even to us?'
'Yeah, even to you guys.'
'What are you talking about, quit messing around'
'I'm not messing around!'
'Yes you are, with that attitude!'
'Hey, hey!'
Seeing things were about to heat up I jump in.
'It's just like old times, seeing you two argue\nlike this.'
'...Don't remind me.'
As if remembering her obstinate past, Kotori\nbitterly becomes sullen.
'Yeah, we often had days like this hey, old man.'
'You can talk, being the Granny who's the oldest,\nand nearing her birthday.'
'Farewell adolescence, farewell young days,\ngoodbye to my Shining Days'
'You give up quick!'
'Yeah, anyway, you're going to hang out with me\non the weekend, right?'
'Yeah.'
Jeez, like always, I reply without thinking.
Wait, what?
'Weekend?'
'Yeah, on the weekend.'
On the weekends I normally go to the gliding area\nor work at Tatsuya's factory.
From the start of next week, we have finals, so I\nwas planning on taking a holiday from both to\nspend some time studying.
'Of course on Sunday you want to study. But on\nSaturday you'd be free to hang out for a little\nwhile, right?'
'Ah, you're asking him out. That's bold.'
'It's not like that!'
If Ageha asks you to hang out, it's always\nchecking out a home center or hardware store.
It's not going to become anything like what\nKotori is expecting.
Before I know it, time ticks away, and the\nweekend...
'One, two, three, four...'
Before heading out, I carefully stretch.
Hibari is here so I don't need to worry about\nKotori.
The Kazato sisters have also already headed out\nto visit their grandfather.
There aren't any real problems at the dormitory .
All that's left to concern myself with is my own\nphysical condition.
I'll almost definitely be made to carry big and\nheavy tools and materials.
Then be made to carry them all the way to the\nsecret base. And do this over and over.
As it's another hot day, I've been sure to\nprepare enough water.
All that's left is to limber up and head out.
OK, it's almost the time we arranged to meet.
It's been ages since I've been out with Ageha.
Seriously, a long time.
Wait?
Has it really... been a long time...?
'...wait a minute.'
Wait, wait.
When... was the last time we hung out together,\njust the two of us?
We often talked one-on-one in the classroom.
Whenever she would come to the dormitory to hang\nout, we often ended up alone.
On the way to Tatsuya's, we always walked\ntogether.
But meeting up like this and going somewhere,\njust the two of us... if I think about it now, it\nhas really been a long time.
'Nah, nah, nah.'
It's more than a long time ago, it's the first\ntime since last year.
Last year, we went to Windy's together. That was\nthe last time.
'...Jeez'
Strangely, I can't compose myself, I feel all\nrestless.
Hold on a second, calm yourself.
It's just Ageha. Just Ageha, right?
It's not like it's somebody special.
And it's not like we're going somewhere romantic\nor anything. Just a home center, hardware store,\nraw goods shop, or even the library...
'Oh, you're already here?'
'Ah, yeah. You're late'
'Heh heh, did I keep you waiting?'
'Waiting around in this heat. I'll get totally\ndehydrated.'
'Ah poor thing. Anyways let's go.'
'Alright.'
Her shoulders are exposed...
Recently I've only seen her in uniform, so it\nseems strangely pretty.
Thin and curved.
And... lovely...
'Hey, something wrong?'
'No, no!'
'Alright. Hey, by the way, Aoi.. You're gorgeous'
'What is?'
'You are.'
'You've got a nice body. Great legs, wide\nshoulders, and a flat stomach.'
'What are you gawking at?!'
'Like I said, your body.'
She says it so bluntly I can't think of a way to\nprotest.
Ageha's eyes continue to look my body up and down\nwithout reserve.
'Yep, yep. Hiding that underneath a uniform is a\ncomplete waste. Seriously, you have a nice body,\nisn't it?'
'You don't skimp out on your training do you?'
'That's... that's just to lose body weight so\nthat I can fly. I also need to sharpen my\nreflexes.'
'Anyways, doesn't this kind of thing usually go\nthe other way?'
'Ah, would that be better for you? Alright, look\nas much as you want.'
As if getting ready to have her measurements\ntaken, Ageha lightly lifts her arms and presents\nher whole body to me.
'No... I mean...'
I can't just blatantly stare at her because she\nsays I can.
From top to bottom... From her hair to her\nfeet...
Ah, sandals... are these going to be okay to\nwear? The heels are pretty high... and her toe\nnails, she's painted them so nicely.
Again my eyes return to the top... knees, legs...\nhips... waist. Was Ageha always this thin?
'...Gulp'
'Hey, your eyes are a little suspicious.'
'You, you're the one who was showing off.'
'Aoi is a creep!'
'You're the creep! You're the one who started\nthis in the first place!'
'You're face is turning bright red.'
'Shut...'
'Haha, Aoi you turn bright red so quickly.'
Because of her smile, I feel a sensation other\nthan embarrassment.
'Well now that we've finished exchanging jabs,\nlet's head off.'
'Why, you dirty...'
'So, where are we going? I prepared myself to\ncarry a lot of heavy things.'
'Yep, yep, I like your willingness to carry Mr.\nLuggage Carrier.'
'Anything up to an eighteen liter drum I can\nhandle. Anything over that and you're barking up\nthe wrong tree.'
'Yeah, yeah. Don't worry I won't be buying\nanything like that.'
Ageha takes the lead and starts walking.
'What're you going to buy? You've already got all\nthe tools you need, right? If it's something\nspecial, right now the budget can't...'
'Well, I don't know if you'd call it special, but\nyou'd call it something.'
'I've had you come along with me while I buy it,\nbut it's not something you could use.'
'I couldn't ?'

Something you can't use unless you're extremely
adept? Something that requires a great deal of
technical knowledge attained through study? Like
that?
But she's only been studying since last year. At\nthis stage, she shouldn't need to buy anything\nlike that.
'Windy's?'
There are all sorts of stores here. Ageha's\nfamily store, Himegi sports, Tasaki's store, Sun\nEaves...

It's on a small scale but there's also a home
center, if you need something you come to this
place and walk around to search for anything you
can use.
'Well, here we are.'
'...Huh? On the top floor?'
Ageha rides the escalator to the top floor.
There's no home center here... I guess she's\ngoing to pop into Himegi Sports?
'Huh?!'
I blurt out as soon as I see where Ageha is\nheaded.
'Underwear?'
It's an underwear store.
A woman's underwear store.
A specialist one at that. Underwear designed for\nyoung women. Various designs. Various colors.\nFrilly types. Erotic types.
'I told you, I'm buying something that you can't\nuse.'
'Yeah you said that, you did say that but...!'

My face turns red, I begin to sweat, I struggle
to find a place to turn my eyes, eventually I
cover my eyes with my hands and stand stock
still.
'Heehee, you're so red.'
'Of course I am!'
'If you keep yelling with your face like that,\npeople are going to look at you.'
'See, see, people are looking, everyone's looking\nat you. They're whispering about you.'
'What's up with that guy, what's he doing in an\nunderwear store, ew, what a creep. It's a\ndeviant! Call the police!'
Wh, Why are you trying to embarrass me like this?
'I, I'm going to be over there.'
'OK, well I'm gonna try on a few pairs, it'll\nprobably take a little while, so just wait a\nbit.'
Try on?!
At an underwear store? In other words...!
I turn my back on the store and try to control my\nbreathing.
I, I have to stop my wild thoughts.
Get control, control yourself, that's it, think\nof the feeling of flight.
Sudden stalling, turbulence, spins, rocking,\ndescent.
If you have an accident on a bicycle, you merely\nhit the ground.
But in a glider, an accident means... falling\nfrom the sky.
So no matter what the situation, you can't lose\ncomposure, to return safely to the ground is the\nmost important thing to a pilot.
Soon I will pass through the passage of cloud.
So to be disturbed by something as trivial as\nthis isn't acceptable.
Calm down, calm down, keep the machine in line\nwith the horizon, catch the wind with the wings.
'Pheeewwww.'
With a deep breath, I somehow regain composure.
That's right, it's only Ageha, when we were\nlittle kids we took baths together.
'Hey, Aoi, what color bras do you like?'
'Chooooooo!'
I can't calm downnnn!!
'Ah hahaha, your face is priceless, priceless!'
'Y-, you little...!'
'OK, OK, I'm done so you can relax.'
'Huh?'
'I'd already decided what I would buy before I\ncame. I had already tried them on a bunch of\ntimes.'
Boastfully, Ageha lifts up a colorful, small box\nresembling a chocolate container.
'Look, my carefully selected bra and panties.\nWanna see?'
'Don't show me!'
'Heh , heh, heh'
Darn it. Men's underwear are so simple, but\nwomen's are like this. They have to be tried on\nand then put into this kind of packaging.
Nah, that's not where the problem lies.
'What exactly are you trying to do?'
'Nothing, I just thought I'd buy the light things\nfirst, it's better than carrying a bunch of heavy\nthings around, right?'
'That's not what I'm talking about.'
'OK, on to the next!'
'Hey, wait!'
The next place was a clothes store on the same\nfloor.
'This is something that I need you to look at for\nme.'
'I'm not gonna fall for your tricks anymore.'
'No seriously... this blouse and that one, which\none do you think is better?'
'They're both fine.'
'Alright, I'll get both!'
'...Is what I would like to be able to say but...\nobviously I don't have that kind of money.'
'C'mon, try to imagine me wearing these.'
'This one and this one. Ah, this one, it's a\nlittle bit daring, what do you think?'
'I don't know! I don't know anything about girl's\nclothes.'
'Exactly why you're here. I want fresh, honest\neyes. I want you to tell me the honest truth.'
'Which one would you want me to wear walking next\nto you.'
'Walking...'
Together? Side by side?
That would be, like a date?
Me and Ageha?
Like boyfriend and girlfriend, all romantic,\nbeing all touchy-feely?
'...Nothing, hey.'
'You'd prefer I wore nothing?!'
'Of course not!'
'Seriously, what kind of a girl talks about this\nwith a guy? Talk about this stuff with other\ngirls!'
'Yeah, but in the end, it's better if the person\nyou want to show it to sees it. Then you can be\ncertain'
'The person you want to see it... you mean...'
'Ah, forget it! You're the worst!'
'What did I do?!'
Ageha suddenly pouts her cheeks.
She seriously looks angry.
'Here's a quiz for you. Where are we now? I'll\ngive you a hint. We spoke about it the other\nday.'
'...Um... the old secret base... I guess?'
We spoke about that, I'm pretty sure.
'Correct! Alright, question two.'
'What did you say to me there?'
'Mmmm...'
At the old... secret base...
Oh... that...?!
She wants to make me say that in this place?!
But Ageha is giving off an intense impression\nthat if I don't say it she will not forgive me.
'Ah... that... well I guess you could say I got\ncarried away, I didn't really understand anything\nthen.'
'Aaahh?!'
Whoa, she looks like she should be in some bad\ncomic the wrinkles on her forehead are amazing.
'Um... you see...'
Ah man, I can't say anymore than this.
I try frantically to move my trembling lips and\nforce out the words.
'I... I like you... will you go out with me... '
Ageha looks flabbergasted .
She turns completely white.
Seriously, completely, dumbfounded,\nastonishingly, speechlessly, aghast.
'Ah... well, um...'
'You're the one who wanted me to say it!'
'That's right, I said 'will you go out with me?'!\nThe way a guy normally says to a girl, I thought\nthat's what you did!'
Whoaah, the dark history I had sealed up until\nnow.
If there was no one around I'd want to cover my\nhead in my hands and roll my head around, I'm so\nembarrassed I could die.

Before I moved away, I got in the age where I
would get excited by reading comics that showed
girl's underwear or by walking around town with a
girl a little bit older than me.
At that time, when I realized that boys are meant\nto tell girls that they like them.
At that time, I said it to the girl I liked the\nmost.
'Ageha!'
When I think about it, the words I said come back\nto me so clearly.
'I like you! Go out with me!'
Then Ageha... She...?
Um, what did she say again?
I remember Ageha's face at that moment.
It was the same as now, dumbfounded, shocked,\npale, eyes and mouth wide open.
But I can't remember what it was she said.
What I do remember is that in the end Ageha\ndidn't go out with me.
In other words I was rejected.
I'm not really sure what brought things to the\npoint where I was like "go out with me".
We were always together, always hanging out,\ntouching wasn't a problem, we would tickle each\nother practicing judo holds, stuff like that.
But what I remember clearly is that my confession\nwasn't accepted.
I totally thought that we fit together and that\nAgeha would be happy, so I was shocked.
And then... it became awkward between us and the\ndays we didn't meet continued.
And while this was happening I had to move, I\nmoved away from Kazegaura.
...and so we get to the present.
'Hrrnnn...!'
Ah, why is it so painful to remember my old self?
Dripping with sweat, labored breathing, face on\nfire. Just like this.
'No... like... uh...'
Ageha, still pale as before, tonelessly murmurs.
'Sorry... I, completely screwed up, I...'
'No, like I mean... what I wanted you to say was,\nit wasn't that.'
'Ageha, you're kinda boyish aren't you?'",\nthat...'
After saying this Ageha turns red and looks at\nthe ground.
This time it's my turn to go completely pale.
Now that she mentions it there were other things\nI said before I "confessed".
'Ageha, you're kind've boyish, aren't you?".'
'You're not a girl. You're bigger than me,\nTotally flat chested".'
'I did say that... didn't I...'
'Right...'
But Ageha and I don't say anything beyond that.
We don't buy any clothes, don't go anywhere in\nparticular, just aimlessly walk around and then\nleave the store.
After we change floors I can finally change the\nmood.
'Well, anyways, I'll buy that for you...'
Affected by guilt, my voice is hoarse and can\nbarely make the words.
'Hmm, I'll forgive you then.'
Ageha suddenly returns back to normal.
As if the pale, shocked expression never existed,\nshe completely returns to high spirits.
Because she returns back to normal I let out a\nrelieved sigh.
'So yeah, what I meant was that.'
'Right.'
'It's your fault.'
'What is?'
'This.'
Ageha lightly holds up the shopping bag in her\nhand.
Those underwear from before... though I can't\nreally see them.
'I look like a boy, you said I am a boy, that was\na huge shock.'
'Then straight after you said it you ran away.'
'I didn't run away, I had to move to a different\ntown.'
'You disappeared from my life, so it's the same\nthing.'
'Hmph.'
'And so I decided.'
As if she were the Statue of Liberty holding up\nher torch, Ageha lifts her crepe high into the\nair.
Whoa, be careful, the contents will spill out!
'I will triumph over that stupid Aoi who\nunderstands nothing.'
'I'll make him apologize for calling me a boy!'
Right when it seems chocolate cream will spill\nall over the place she swiftly lowers her crepe.
'Munch, chomp, chomp. Mmmm delicious.'
After taking a bite she happily breaks into a big\ngrin.
'Then it was awoken!'
'The power lying dormant in your right arm?!'
'Yes, continuing unbroken from ancient times. The\nmark of magic beings living amongst humans rises\nto the surface. This evil, marked right arm.'
Whoa, she said it all in one breath.
'So, what then?'
'Fashionably'
As if it were nothing we continue. We aren't a\nstylish pair by any means.
'Like a girl. Cute. To the point that you'll fall\nhead over heels for me.'
'Aoi, you'll grovel at my feet. Me, the cute girl\nyou said bad things about.'
'Oh that... I guess I should give you a written\napology.'
'Yeah, yeah... A formal declaration is more like\nit. It still probably wouldn't be enough.'
Ageha begins to flap her empty hand.
'I'm going to chastise you, later, slowly.'
'Solder my fingers?! Melt my eyelids?! Ah,\nmechanical tools are terrifying in this\nsituation.'
'A drill in your heart, an arc weld to your\nspirit.'
'Open up my chest and pour molten metal inside,\nwhoa.'
'What would you like on your gravestone?'
'A boy who yearned for the sun, rests alone. His\nsoul is one with the Morning Glory.'
'OK, have your last meal!'
Having taken a huge morsel of crepe she thrusts\nit before my eyes.
'Hey, this is your portion, you didn't get one,\nright?'
'Nah it's OK, I don't need any.'
'I have to eat it all by myself? I don't know,\nthat kinda feels weird.'
'Alright I'll buy myself one.'
'No, no it's fine.'
She forces the crepe on me.
This...
Well it is Ageha...
We used to get along so well a long time ago.
No, not that long, it was only last year we would\nshare indirect kisses when tasting ice cream.
'Alright, I'll have some. Munch.'
... That's right, this was totally normal for us\nback in the day.
Stealing each other's ice cream, scrambling to be\nthe first to lick one ice cream, our lips\ntouching each other.
Biting into the crepe, the texture, the sweet\ntaste of the cream filling my mouth.
... And a different kind of sweetness.
A strange sweetness which makes my heart race.\nSweetness mixed with a little embarrassment.
I didn't feel this way last year... maybe because\nit's a crepe...
'Mmm... munch...'
'Ah, it's good, right?'
'Mm... yeah...'
'... Hmmm... It's not like it used to be, huh?'
'Of course, to begin with we look completely\ndifferent.'
'Right. Aoi, you've become a total stud.'
'You also...'
I recalled the moment I first saw Ageha after\ncoming back to this town.
I didn't realize it was Ageha and just thought it\nwas a cute girl.
'Hm? What is it?'
'You were about to say something interesting,\nright? Don't hide it, just say it. I'll dig it\nout of you no matter what!'
Whoa, acting all high and mighty.
'Nothing, like I said before, You've also become\na beautiful girl.'
'Ah, right... At the time you came back.'
'Alright, I'll take that.'
'Because of what you said, I decided to make\nmyself beautiful, and finally you've recognized\nthat. Mission accomplished!'
'... But still, your praise, it's.. Still not\nquite enough, is it?'
'I want to hear what you said at that time.'
'At that time?'
'You know, the time I said 'I've become a pretty\ngirl, right?' Your reply at that time was\nperfect.'
'So here we go, one more time, I've become a\npretty girl, right?'

'A splendid girl. A beautiful girl. The very
essence of woman. There isn't another girl in the
world who represents the quintessence of
womanhood any better.'
'Show me your back. I'll draw the blueprint on it\nwith a stencil pen.'
'Don't you call that a tattoo?'
'It's torture buddy.'
'A perfect girl.'
'One more time.'
'Beautiful.'
'You're forgiven!'
Good to know.
'But still, you may as well say it again.'
'You're real cute, Ageha.'
'You too, Aoi. You're realyl handsome.'
We both suddenly take on a serious expression and\nlook deep into each other's eyes.
And then at the same time we burst out laughing.
'Ah ha-ha, haven't laughed like that for a\nwhile.'
After we laugh for a while, we wipe the tears\nfrom our eyes.
Whaa, I haven't laughed this hard for ages, my\nstomach hurts.
'There's no doubt, you're the only one who I can\nhave fun like this with.'
'Me too, I can only have fun with a girl like\nyou.'
'We're the best of friends, right?'
'Yeah, we...'
For some reason the word 'friends' gets stuck in\nmy throat.
'... Hey, Ageha...'
'Yeah?'
'I thought the reason I came today was to buy\nthings for the club?'
'Right.'
'So, how did it turn into this?'
'Ah, well, I can see how you would wonder that.\nIt being a pre-exam date and all!'
That word, again, for some reason it knocks me\nback.
That can't be the reason Ageha came out.
The word 'date', the uneasy feeling it causes.\nWhat is this?
'But yeah, this is our only chance.'
'... For what?'
'To have a breather.'
'Next week is finals, after that's over... after\nthat we can finally give undivided attention to\nthe glider.'
'We'll be absorbed in the glider. Making it,\nflying it.'
'That's true...'
'From morning till night, building. On top of\nthat we won't know if we'll finish on time until\nthe end.'
'You'll have to focus even more intently on fly\ntraining.'
'We won't be able to think of anything else.'
'What's wrong with that?'
'I don't think it's good to have only that.'
'I have experience from being in the robot club.\nTo be absorbed completely in something, morning\nuntil night, can actually lead to failure.'
'No matter what's going on, for me there's only\nthis, nothing beyond this, I can't think of\nanything else'
'If you close off your world like that, you stop\nhearing what other people say, you end up\nimprisoning yourself.'
'As hard as we're working there is no way we\nwon't succeed. We aren't taking any days off so\nit's fine.'
'If you do it like this and you fail ... with a\nrobot it just means it doesn't work probably and\nyou lose competitions. That's all that happens.'
'But with a glider... you die.'
A shiver passes through me.
The bicycle... I recall the accident.
'So, sometimes kind of letting up a little, is\njust as important as seriously working hard. In\nmy opinion.'
'...I suppose so.'
I suppose it's just as she says.
Our opponent is the sky.
Vast and beautiful, perfect... but also a place\nthat will snatch your life away in an instant.
On that point, the instructors at the glider area\nare constantly emphasizing.
Having flown many times and learned all the\ntechniques, I've come to understand this more\nthan anyone.
After seeing Amane's flight last year, I've come\nto learn just how dangerous it is...
There's no guarantee you'll make it back in one\npiece.
To ensure something bad like that doesn't happen.
To the same extent as you immerse yourself, you\nshould ease up, broaden your outlook, don't\nforget to make composed judgments.
Just in case, even if the Morning Glory occurs, I\nneed to be able to judge whether I should turn\nback and land.
If I throw myself into it too completely, I won't\nbe able do that.
I saw it at the cycle racing arena.

Having raced so far, striving for a perfect
finish, through dehydration or muscle failure, so
many athletes have irrecoverably
injured	hemselves.
'Well, anyway, for now you've relaxed a little\nbit, right?'
'Yeah.'
Jeez, this girl... she understands me more than\nanyone.
Having been friends for a long time, right now I\nreally appreciate it.
'Alright then, let's start your trial.'
My mind can't keep up.
'Your trial. OK. I open the court. The defendant,\nAoi Minase, please sit there.'
'The defendants crime; recently, without\ndiscrimination, he has been molesting women all\nover the place.'
'Unbelievable, this dishonorable, unfaithful,\npervert, of loose morals, frivolous and\nwhimsical.'
'Hey, what are you talking about?!'
'The first charge. He embraced Amane.'
'That? She hugged me!'
'The second charge. He went on a date with\nKanako.'
'To flags was it? How nice, so romantic.'
'It's not like that. All we did was eat ice\ncream! And she's the one who invited me!'
'The third charge. You've been chatting up to\nKumoi, making advances, seducing, that is\noutrageous behavior!'
'Who, who's been saying that about me?!'
'Look, Ma-bou was there as well! I want to call a\nwitness!'
'Ahh, excuses!'
'Hey look, in the end, trying not to look too\nclose inside school, that strategy, the person\nwho thought of that was you, right?'
'This is true.'
'But that doesn't mean you can bury your face in\nAmane's chest, hold Kanako's hand and try to get\nKumoi.'
'I didn't!!'
'You didn't?'
'You can't just blatantly twist the facts like\nthat.'
'Why don't you do those things?'
'You want me to?!'
'If you don't, it means I can't chastise you!'
'Your methods and objectives are contradicting\nthemselves!'
'Ah, I've been found out.'
'Punishment before the fact, you're horrible.'
'Aahh, a pervert, he's molesting me, help!'
'I don't want to hear that kind of talk from a\nfreak who shows her panties off.'
'OK, fine, to make up for it, You can show me\nyour underwear.'
'That doesn't make up for anything!'
'That's sexual equality.'
'Right, then do the same laborious work I do.'
'You want to make a woman carry heavy things?\nThat's terrible.'
'Using a man to your heart's content is just as\nbad, so right back at you.'
'OK, so we're both horrible We'll call it a\ndraw.'
'You're the one who tried to draw me into a trap\nright from the start.'
'Don't fret over such trivial details, you're\ngoing to live in the vast sky, right?'
'Hey, in order to fly in the sky I never overlook\nthe small details!'
'... Actually, about that...'
While engaging in this stupid back and forth,\nsomething pops into my head.
'Why not Hotaru?'
'Sorry?'
'Hotaru. You brought up Amana, Kumoi, Nanako, but\nyou said nothing about Hotaru.'
To which Ageha, with a look of surprise, blinks\nso hard I think I can almost hear it.
'Well, you know, Hotaru's... there's no chance.'
'No chance... of what?'
'Nah, you know... Aoi... um?'
Ageha's eyes swim.
To gain control of her thoughts, her eyes fix on\na point where no one is. They stay there.
But what exactly is giving her so much strife?
'Hotaru is, safe... There's no danger, right?'
'Well, yeah, I mean I wouldn't try anything funny\nwith her.'
'Right?'
'But did you think that I would try to with the\nothers?'
'No, I mean it's you.'
'Well I'm glad you think you can trust me.'
'I mean it's you, and it's Hotaru... so there\nisn't a problem, right?'
Completely unlike her, Ageha's way of speaking\nlacks confidence.
'What are you all flustered about?'
'Hmmm, I don't know.'
'Hold on.'
'Look, it doesn't matter. If it's important it'll\ncome out eventually.'
'It'll cause problems if it doesn't.'
'Enough, OK.'
Her voice takes on a serious tone.
'Well, anyways... that's that so let's have a\nlittle bit more fun.'
'OK, fine.'
After that, for a while, we forget about the sky,\nthe exams, everything and have fun together.
...But still, what was bothering her, it seems\nthat Ageha doesn't even understand it herself.
'Haa, that was fun, wasn't it?'
'Yeah it was.'
I always spend my holidays working or doing\nflight training, so haven't had fun like this for\nages.
'I feel bad for everyone else, but it really was\nfun.'
'Yeah, I had fun too.'
My hands are filled with shopping bags.
After that I still ended up going to even more\nstores and got stuck with Ageha buying clothes.
And of course I have to carry them.
'By the way, you sure can buy a lot of clothes.'
'What are you talking about? This is a normal\namount for a girl. Too little even.'
'Ah right.'
'Guys might buy less stuff, but it's usually more\nexpensive. That's what my mom says.'
'Well... I can't deny that.'
I laugh bitterly.
If it's parts for my bike, someone who doesn't\nknow might be dumbstruck by the price I pay for\nthem.
'Ah yeah, seeing you carrying everything, come\ninside, my mom will be really happy to see you.'
'Sorry to intrude.'
I enter the Himegi residence.
The old Himegi house was a sports goods store on\nthe first floor, then in the back and on the\nsecond floor were the living quarters.
Because I thought it was cool she lived in a\nsports goods store, along with the secret base I\noften came to play there.
Now their shop is located in Windy's and the\nHimegi family live in a house close by.
Of course this isn't my first time here.
I've already come to visit a bunch of times this\nyear.
'Welcome back... Ah?!'
'Hey Hotaru.'
'Hey, I'm home.'
'It's Aoi!'
'Hey, you're sister's here.'
'Aoi is in our house. Weird.'
'Ageha's here as well, you know.'
'Ah, so you are.'
'... Aoi, sorry but could you go home I have to\nhave a heated discussion with my sister. Mostly\nusing my fists.'
'Hey, you'd be more beautiful if you got along.'
'This is preordained, for sisters bound by blood.\nThis sadness of conflict is unavoidable. It's\ndestiny predetermined.'
'Huh? H-,Hey, Hotaru?'
Isn't this a bit off character for you? And by\nthat I mean too off character!
'This is the time to release my true power. So,\ncome at me if you dare.'
'Heh heh, to think I would have to use this\ntechnique .'
Ageha takes on a stance, opens up both arms and,\nin a strange way, begins twirling them.
'Whoa!?'
'Eek!'
With a whoosh, a figure appears behind Ageha...\nand in that same instant, 'it' occurs.
With a shock, Ageha flies into the air.
No seriously. Both legs completely separate from\nthe ground.
'Jeez... my stupid daughters... what are you\ndoing in front of our guest?'
'Excuse my intrusion.'
'Oh, Aoi, you're here.'
'H...Hey kicking me in the butt out of nowhere is\na foul.'
'I'm confiscating your comics as well. This is\nfor teaching Hotaru stupid things.'
Of course it's that. I felt like I'd heard those\nlines before.
'Ageha, did I do it right?'
'Yup, totally perfect.'
After giving the thumbs up Ageha gets another\nkick to the butt.
Goodbye Ageha. I'll never forget you.
'...You went out with Ageha?'
'Yeah.'
'She's lucky...'
Me carrying parcels and shopping bags looks\nenviable to Hotaru. Definitely a girl's way of\nthinking.
'Sorry, for just the two of us going. Next time\nwe'll all go together.'
'Okay!'
'Something wrong?'
'Nothing.'
What a weirdo...
'Oh, my butt, it still totally stings.'
'You reap what you sow.'
I was invited to stay for dinner but I have to\nmake dinner for the others in the dorm, so I\ndecline and leave.
As I apologize and head off Ageha receives a\nthird kick in the butt.
'Mom, you're too violent!'
'You'll probably be like that one day.'
'Noooo!'
'Well I guess, that butt kicking technique I can\naccept doing that.'
'Please don't!'
'Hahaha, it's OK, I'll only use it on you.'
'That's worse.'
'I'll be doing it out of love.'
'I don't need that kind of love.'
'Ah yeah, you still have time right? Can you take\na quick detour.'
'Where to? An-chan's?'
'Nah, nah.'
'Whoa!'
'We haven't been here for a while, have we?'
'The grass has grown.'
'You guys are still alive huh?'
It's been a year since the last time we flew\nhere.
From then on we've been hiding the glider as\ncarefully as possible.
Not just the flying, but we've had to hide the\nexistence of the soaring club itself.
Without thinking I hold out both my arms wide.
...The sky
It's so vast, it expands forever, the sky.
Different to the glider area, here above our\ntown, the sky above our Kazegaura!
My desire to fly flows out of me stronger than\never.
I want to go to the sky.
I want to pass through the passage of clouds.
In the glider we made.
In our own wings, into this sky!
'Oooohhhhhh!!'
Without resisting my impulses, I yell out.
'Yeeeaaaahhhhhhhh!'
'...What?'
'Well I can't lose to you now, can I?'
'I like your attitude.'
I look out over the lake as it sparkles with the\nlight of the fading sun, without thinking I\ninhale sharply.
'I'm gonna FLY!!!'
'Yeah!!!!'
Ageha gets caught up in the same excitement.
'...Ageha. Um...'
'I got it. You want to know what I've been doing,\nright?'
These days Ageha has been doing something\nseparate to the rest of us.
What has she been doing? This is what I really\nwant to ask.
As well as that I want to confirm one thing.
Right now I just yelled 'I'm gonna fly!
But Ageha didn't say that.
'In order to make the glider you're helping out a\nlot, right?'
'Right.'
'I'm sure about what you do in the club room. But\nwhat else have you been doing?'
'It's a secret.'
'Why?! Something you can't tell the rest of us?'
'Yes, I'm sorry, but it is.'
'Because you think we'll tell others? You can't\ntrust us?'
'No, it's not that... um...'
After searching my expression, Ageha lightly\nshrugs her shoulders.
'Fine, I'll tell you and only you Aoi. You can't\ntell Kotori, Asa or Yoru.'
'Fine.'
'If it was found out it would cause a lot of\ntrouble I'm trusting you.'
'Would you be examined by Tobioka?.'
'More than that. At best I'll be expelled.'
'At best'... You mean...'
'That's why it's best you don't know. If you know\nyou'll become an accomplice.'
'Accomplice...?'

'Sometimes, it's best you don't know, or
sometimes it would be more helpful if you didn't
know, seriously. And that's why I'm not going to
tell you.'
'I understand that... But...'
'But I... if I'm protected like that I really\ndon't like it.'
'If you were to disappear, we couldn't fly\nright?'
'Well yeah that's true, but if you say that,\nyou're the same right? If you aren't here we\ncan't make the glider.'
'You've got Kotori, Asa, and Yoru.'
'If you don't trust them, we have a problem.'
'There are other people more skillful, better\nwith machines, more experienced in construction.\nMany more.'
'But... in terms of people who want to fly,\nthere's only you Aoi.'
'And not just fly, but to fly in your own glider.\nThere aren't many people who think like this.'
'That's why Aoi, Kotori, Asa, you guys have to be\na part of this.'
I struggle to find words.
Logically speaking, she's right.
But...!
'But... I... Ageha if you're doing something\ndangerous, and if you were to disappear...\nthat...'
'I don't want to fly if it comes to that. If it\ncomes to that it would be better not to fly.'
'I want to fly with everyone, together. If it's\nnot all of us I don't want to do it.'
'Yeah... yeah you're right.'
'Aoi, you've always been that kind of person,\nhaven't you?'
'Of course, we're friends.'
'Right, best friends.'
Ageha lightly thrusts out a clenched fist.
I lightly tap her fist with my own.
'We'll fly, all of us together.'
'Right.'
'I'm happy you're doing so much to help. But\nplease don't make me worry. Don't do anything\ndangerous, OK?'
'OK. I'll do my best.'
'Do your best? Hey, look here.'
'There's nothing I can do. It would be nice to be\nable to fly normally by doing normal work. But\nwe're not in that kind of position.'
'So at some point we have to do something a\nlittle dangerous. If nobody takes any risks\nthings won't turn out well.'
'Somebody has to do it, Aoi.'
'Don't give me that face I'm going all out right\nhere.'
Ageha, doesn't look at me but somewhere in the\nsky that I was just looking at.
'We'll make it fly again, right? That white\nmachine.'
'Yeah.'
'And then we'll protect everyone's place.'
'I really don't want a repeat of last year.'
'Yeah.'
The collapsing garage. The shock I received from\nthose sights, those sounds, even now. Just\nremembering it makes my chest hurt.
'This time we will definitely succeed. Into the\nsky that no one has seen, in the machine we made,\nI want you to fly there, Aoi.'
'It's for that reason I'm working so hard. We're\ndoing everything in our power. Because of that,\nAoi, you will definitely fly.'
'Ageha.'
I feel really ashamed.
Just because she hadn't been to the secret base,\nshe hasn't been working beside us. Just because\nof that I felt distanced from her.
Ageha, more than all of us had been completely\nearnestly, sincerely, desperate to succeed.
Because I realized this I feel...
'...I'm definitely going to fly in the glider\nthat everyone has made. I will pass through the\nMorning Glory.'
Right now, what's needed of me, isn't to feel\nsorry for or apologize to Ageha.
What I need to do is to use my actions to make\nAgeha's hopes come alive. To become her\nexpression of determination.
'I know.'
Ageha replies with a smile.
This was her most beautiful smile today.
